unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Describing the Distribution
question_text: X 1 2 3 4 5 6 P(X) 0.04 0.11 0.33 0.35 0.14 0.03 A local police officer gives out between $1$ and $6\text{ tickets a day}$ , the probability distribution table of which is shown above, where $X$ is the number of tickets handed out on any given day. One can describe this distribution as...

choices.text: Approximately normal, with a center of 3.5 3.5 .
A distribution with a center of about 3.5 3.5 , but describing the distribution using shape does not make sense in this situation.
Uniform with a center of 3 3 or 4 4 ; one must give integer values for center since a police officer cannot give out a non-integer amount of tickets on a given day.
Approximately normal, with a center of 3 3 or 4 4 ; one must give integer values for center since a police officer cannot give out a non-integer amount of tickets on a given day.
